Pumpshock

About Pumpshock

A simple workout tracker that allows you to create and track your workout history. It also gives you stats on what your favourite exercises are base on your workout history. Scroll to the bottom of this page to take a look at my motivation for embarking on this project!

View Demonstration!

Demonstration

Login at Pumpshock to start using the workout tracker! To being, visit the workouts page to create a workout. You can use any one of the built-in exercises or even create your own. Once done, you can start the workout and record the time taken as well as whether you completed all your sets. This session will be stored under the history page, where you can refer to it any time you want.

Learnings

This project was built using Next.js, FaunaDB and GraphQL. With my interest in learning more about GraphQL and also NoSQL databases, I embarked on making this workout tracking application. The biggest take away for me was the importance of designing an app with an approach that prioritised the user experience. After having made the initial version of this app, I had thought that it was a really functional and simple design. However, when I gave it to my friends and family for viewing, multiple issues with the UI were surfaced and I had to go back to the drawing board and come up with a better design, taking into account all of the criticism. This process completely changed my view of how I should be approaching web design or infact the designing of any product.
